message:
Founded in 2008 by IIT Kharagpur alumni- Aneesh Reddy and Krishna Mehra, Capillary Technologies has come a long way and claims to have more than 300 Mn consumers on its SaaS platform!
With the newly raised funds, the startup aims to strengthen its product development, by deploying Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. 
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team of Capillary Technologies, and wishes them all the best for their future endeavours.

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the founders of Help Us Green on being featured in the Forbes top 30 under 30 list.
Help Us Green is aimed at recycling religious waste in the Ganga such as waste flowers into lifestyle products. They were also the winners of Social track of Empresario 2k17.

In 1999, after working for more than 8 technology companies, he decided to start his own venture, and ultimately went on to become the maker of more than 10 startups since then. After retirement, he wrote a book which launched the lean startup movement. In 2013, Forbes listed him under the 30 most influential people in tech., with a net worth of $2.5 Billion! Popularly called as one of the Godfathers of the silicon valley, Steve Blank is a personality worth admiring! 
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 on 4th February, 9:30 AM.
#GES2k18

It is those countless attempts,uncontrollable frustration and heart breaking failures that make the success taste so sweet. It is the victory that counts but it is the journey that adds to your character. Failure certainly is inevitable. But what if you knew the success mantra of your role models who have tredded a similar path and today are success personified. Join us in a Panel Discussion on 'If I knew then what I know now' during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!
#GES2k18

With AI and ML becoming the buzzwords of marketplace,they are all set to be the most disruptive forces in technology. But then our living,breathing Tony Stark ,Mr. Elon Musk has stated ”With artificial intelligence,we’re summoning the demons.” And this raises a big question! Is the advent of AI an inevitable reality or sheer exaggeration? 
Join us as our panelists welcome this new era at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February 2018.
#GES2k18

Cryptocurrencies have been the talk of the town for quite some time now, with Facebook recently banning cryptocurrency ads since some exchanges were not acting in "Good Faith". Selecting a proper cryptocurrency exchange is a tedious job, since the whole process is completely decentralised and involves no guarantee from the government. 
Join us in a Certified Workshop on "Cryptocurrencies & Blockchains" by Zebpay and make Baby steps towards cryptocurrency trading, during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!
#GES2k18

This is just the beginning, Stay tuned for more such exciting exhibitions!
Register at: ges.ecell-iitkgp.org/register

Imagine a four year old kid tiptoeing his way to the top of a car window with mojhris in his hand at a traffic signal. Who would have thought that the same kid would introduce E-commerce in India in 1997, years before the industry flourished. Later, in 2004, he founded Palador Pictures- which went on to become one of the largest libraries of World Cinemas. Selling Mojhris was probably his first entrepreneurial venture!
Be a part of Mr. Gautam Shiknis' talk on "Accessing Capital to Global Markets" during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!
#GES2k18

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added an event.
message:
Cryptocurrencies, popularly called as Money 2.0, are all set to bring in a revolution in the Financial Market. But veterans like Warren Buffett have cautioned us to stay away from this Blockchain based currency.
Lately, there has been a huge infusion of money into Bitcoins and altcoins, but the volatility in the cryptocurrency market has resulted into numerous administrations banning the use of cryptocurrencies.  Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur invites you a session where experts from India and abroad will clear all the myths about cryptocurrencies, trading patterns, and the future of the highly speculated form of currency!
Date: 02:30PM
Time: 03-02-2018
Veunu: Kalidas Auditorium

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur conducted the Demo Day of Kharagpur Angel Network at Matrix Partners India Office in Bangalore recently. The event gave five shortlisted startups of alumni and students of KGP to pitch in front of institutional investors from Matrix Partners, Ankur Capital, Lead Angels, Ventureast and Vida Ventures and many angel investors as well.

The Panel Discussion witnessed Amod Malviya, Co-founder of UDAAN and Rajesh Yabaji, Cofounder and CEO of Blackbuck sharing their inspirational story about why and how they started up. The two stalwart KGP entrepreneurs with their deep experience and passion motivated the budding entrepreneurs.

The event culminated with the Networking Session where KGP entrepreneurs, Angels and VCs discussed the KGP start up scenario and the general market trends. Overall, it was a very enriching session for the emerging KGP entrepreneurs.

Technology giant Google has a mission to empower more and more people with internet access, thereby getting more people to sell to. In 2013, Google India started converting the 163-year old Indian Railways into a fibre optic network to bring internet to all. Today, the service has expanded to more than 150 stations across the country, with more than 7 Million monthly active users!
The man heading this project is Gulzar Azad, who has converted the idea of setting up a 45,000 kilometres wireless infrastructure, into a reality!
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February.
#GES2k18

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur with Catapooolt.
message:
Catapooolt Product Czars in association with Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur presents the Kharagpur Chapter of India's Largest Product Hunt launched with the objective of helping product based startups through mentoring, funding and media visibility!
Showcase your innovation during GES'18 and get a chance to connect with investors and raise fund via crowdfunding.

If you are a Product based startup who is looking for funding opportunities, Register at: productczars.catapooolt.com
Only GES Participants can pitch their products in the event. Register for GES at: ges.ecell-iitkgp.org/register

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
In the last 5 years, Startup activity in India has gained immense velocity. While you might be willing to toil and put everything on the line to launch your dream venture, numbers aren't quite good on your side, 90% of the startups fail. 
At the beginning, you need to accelerate your startup's growth substantially. 

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur presents a series of Startup Growth hacking workshops where eminent personalities from different industries will talk about different aspects of scaling up a new venture.
Catch them live during GES'18 from 2nd-4th February!
Register at: www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org
#GES2k18

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with Matrix Partners calls out to all the entrepreneurs, innovators and investors from the KGP community to come together and celebrate this vibrant ecosystem of our startups through KAN. We look forward to seeing you all at the Matrix Partners Bangalore office Rooftop on 24th January. As always, KGP ka tempo high hai!

As part of the event, we are delighted to announce that we will have Amod Malviya (Co-founder, Udaan) and Rajesh Yabaji (Cofounder and CEO, Blackbuck) join in a panel discussion on "All things Kgp and Startup" moderated by Raghav Nagarajan, Investment Professional from Matrix. 

If you are interested in being a part of the Panel Discussion and Networking session please RSVP here: https://tinyurl.com/ecell-kan2018

If you are an Investor who wants to discover the IIT Kharagpur startup ecosystem, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/kan/investform.php

PS: The networking event is invite only as seats are limited, please fill in the form early!

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
Presenting to you, the first element of GES 2018!

Cryptocurrencies, popularly called as Money 2.0, are all set to bring in a revolution in the Financial Market. But veterans like Warren Buffett have cautioned us to stay away from this Blockchain based currency.

In order to clear this never ending dilemma of whether to invest or not, Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur invites you to three interactive sessions that includes experts from India and abroad.
Register now: www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org

The Indian startup eco-system has seen tremendous growth and value creation in the last decade. IIT Kharagpur, with over 200 startups from campus, has been on the forefront of this startup revolution. 

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur hence calls out to all the entrepreneurs, innovators and investors from the KGP community to come together and celebrate this vibrant ecosystem of our startups through KAN. We look forward to seeing you all at the Matrix Partners Bangalore office Rooftop on 24th January. As always, KGP ka tempo high hai!

If you are a startup which has at least one KGP co-founder and are looking to raise funding, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/kan/startupform.php (Deadline Monday 15th Jan 2018)

If you are an Investor who wants to discover the IIT Kharagpur startup ecosystem, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/kan/investform.php

If you are interested in being a part of the Networking session and further meet a lot of KGP people, apply here: https://tinyurl.com/ecell-kan2018

PS: The networking event is invite only as seats are limited, please fill in the form early!

Interested Startups can register at: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/pexpo

Computers, Automobiles, Internet and Smartphones were simple products at their time, but have revolutionized the world within 20 years of their inventions. Products are the basic ingredients which are powerful enough to change the lifestyle of the globe.

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur invites all innovative product based startups who believe their product can disrupt various sectors through AI, ML, IoT and hardware. 

Interested Startups can register at: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/pexpo

message:

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos — with Zone Startups/India.
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur recently organised the first ever edition of its Lean Startup Drive in the startup city of India- Bengaluru, in association with Skillenza and Zone Startups/India Adopting lean startup methodologies for an early stage startup is vital, the mantras of developing a Minimum Viable Product(MVP) were given by eminent entrepreneurs like Rohith Veerajappa and Manik Choudhary. A number of startups including Swatronix, NayaGaadi and Zingo Hotels were also present, in what turned out to be a really amazing local startups meet. 
#LSD2k18
#Bengaluru

The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-

Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit 
The objective of this stage is to find a problem worth solving 

Stage 2: Product-Market Fit 
The objective of this stage is to build something people want and validate your business model 

Stage 3: Scale After Product/Market 
Here, your main objective is to SCALE. 

We often see start-ups in the pursuit of Product-Market Fit without actually achieving Problem-Solution Fit. Adopting Lean startup methodologies is very essential for any early stage startup.
To develop MVP(Minimum Viable Product), Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur, & Zone Start-ups present Lean Start-up Drive. 
Learn the mantras of excelling with the best possible output for you. Interact, ask and learn!
Venue: The Thought Factory, Bengaluru
Date & Time: 23rd December 2017 | 10 A.M
Register at: ecell-iitkgp.org/lsd

Another year comes to an end. In the Indian startup ecosystem, a lot of businesses flourished, while some failed terribly this year. A lot of people were involved in making these businesses big, and a mammoth amount of money was spent to fund these ventures.
Lets take a look at the people who mattered the most in 2017 and how they changed the Indian startup ecosystem for what it is at the end of 2017-

P.S: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is back with the 11th Edition of its annual corporate summit- The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018. For more information, visit:-www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
A workshop on Product Engineering and IP Commercialisation was conducted by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with RMoSEE. We saw participation from Prodex, Technology Transfer Group, RGSOIPL and RMoSEE. The speaker, Mr. Kameshwar Eranki, Founder and CEO, VajraSoft Inc.,USA, threw light on the impact  of disruptive technologies on future markets and the ease of management of one's Intellectual Property through technological advancements. 
Additionally, a hands-on demo was shown to the participants in areas of Reverse Engineering, 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping.
